panels.background: projects materializing as proof of being

dialogue.text: "Look, I still care enough to make something." Even if it never gets applause. Even if it's just to avoid disappearing entirely.

psychological_notes: The core psychological truth emerges - we create not for success but as proof we still care, still exist, still engage with being. Personal projects become acts of resistance against existential disappearance. The lack of applause doesn't diminish their value; their existence itself is the victory.
philosophical_underpinning: Creation as existential affirmation - I make, therefore I am
therapeutic_direction: Recognizing the profound value in the simple act of caring enough to create
